name: places/ChIJwcHHOu9YwokR73xxYxVZlF4
formattedAddress: 817 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 817 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10065-7601, USA

originalText.text: Definitely one of my favorite Equinox locations! Check in staff are always friendly. Exercise equipment is great but the stair-masters location on the floor is a little tight. I can always get a good steam session in the women’s locker room and the cold shower plunge inside makes it all worth it! I head downstairs for a nice back and forth in the jacuzzi and cold plunge and I am golden! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

text.text: Definitely one of my favorite Equinox locations! Check in staff are always friendly. Exercise equipment is great but the stair-masters location on the floor is a little tight. originalText.text: I slipped and fell on a wet floor leading into the men's locker room. A worker had been cleaning the floor, which was slippery from water and soap. He was around the corner and not visible from where I slipped. When he saw that I fell, he merely pointed to the "Wet Floor" sign (which also was not visible from where I was walking), turned away and continued cleaning. He showed no concern and did not ask whether I was ok. (Other members have posted complaints about how nasty the locker room attendants in this club are). I communicated what happened to an assistant manager, who assured me I would hear from the manager the next day. I also communicated to her that the walls in the pool area are often crawling with bugs, which other members have also noticed. I used to give the club 5-star reviews but now I question what value Equinox provides for the $300 a month membership fee they charge.

originalText.text: This equinox is frequently crowded. I visit at all different hours and the location is so full I’m not able to use the machines that I want. Also the pool and sauna are so full I cannot use them. For the amount I’m paying for the destination, I’d expect to be able to get my workout in without having to wait in line.

Also the pool and sauna are so full I cannot use them. For the amount I’m paying for the destination, I’d expect to be able to get my workout in without having to wait in line.

originalText.text: Sadly I injured my back under the supervision of their personal trainer. The gym suspended my membership, but other than that they didn’t offer any relief, compensation or apologies. I am very disappointed and others should be aware that my injury required medical attention and therapies I had to pay for.

I am very disappointed and others should be aware that my injury required medical attention and therapies I had to pay for.

originalText.text:
I was ripped of with almost $2,000 by Equinox. I requested a frizz on my account because I was leaving the country. I called multiple and emailed this location and Equinox every time a charge to my card was made to tell them to stop and they continued to take the money from my account without my permission and against my will.

Equinox is robbing people.

Also, this location is tiny; it only has one leg press machine and only one machine to do other work out, and is lacking many machines.

Please note: at this location you will find needles  on the steam room floor.

I am looking to submit a lawsuit online against them.
